fields.summary: [Python] Conversion from datetime.datetime to timstamp('ns') can overflow

worklogs.comment:
alamb opened a new pull request #7980:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7980


   Proposed follow up to  https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7975 -- rename `PhysicalPlannerImpl` to `DefaultPhysicalPlanner` to better describe what it is and that the design allows for more than one.
   
   I considered a more specific name like `SingleNodeMultiThreadedPlanner` but I felt a lot of that was a function of the Physical nodes that got created rather than the planner itself.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [Python] Pyarrow allows for unsafe conversions of datetime objects to timestamp nanoseconds

comments.body:
[~Joshual] thanks for the report! We should indeed ensure that this raises. 

On casting we already check for this and raise appropriately:

{code}
In [13]: pa.array(np.array([datetime(2262,4,12)])).cast(pa.timestamp('ns'))                                                                                                                                        
...
ArrowInvalid: Casting from timestamp[us] to timestamp[ns] would result in out of bounds timestamp: 9223372800000000
{code}

but this should also be done in the typed array converter.
Sorry about the noise, another PR had a typo in the issue number, which led to this automatically being closed.
